intro: Piriqueta cistoides var. micrantha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved rockrose, is a shrub native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and clusters of bright yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it well-suited for arid and semi-arid environments. Its compact growth habit and drought tolerance make it a popular choice for xeriscaping. The flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to local biodiversity.
